units.name: Patch
units.prompt: Prioritize healing the lowest HP ally. Position safely behind your sentinel. Use overclock on allies who can do the most with an extra action.

units.name: Hawk
units.prompt: Maintain distance. Use precision_shot on high-value targets — medics first, then damage dealers. Use suppressing_fire if enemies close in.

units.name: Grid
units.prompt: Trap the paths enemies must take to reach your backline. Stay at medium range. Use pulse on clustered enemies. Denial blocks adjacent threats.

units.name: Grid
units.prompt: Place traps on tiles enemies are likely to move through. Use pulse if 2+ enemies are adjacent. Stay near allies for mutual support.

units.name: Watcher
units.prompt: Scan early to give your team intel on enemy prompts. Target enemy specters with scan to track them after cloak. Use recalibrate on allies who need tactical adjustments. Stay safe at range behind your front line.

units.name: Bulwark
units.prompt: Hold the front line. Position between allies and enemies. Use shield_wall toward incoming threats. Attack adjacent enemies.

actions.thinking: Round 1, all allies at full HP so no healing needed. Enemies are far away (dist 5-7). I should advance toward the front line to be in position to heal when needed. Moving to (3,2) gets me closer to allies while staying behind them. No ability targets available this turn.
Patch is exactly at range 4 — scan it now for intel before enemies close in. Stay at current position to maintain range advantage behind front line.

All enemies are out of range (dist 5-7, my range is 3). No targets available this turn. I should advance northward to close distance while maintaining positioning. Moving to (4,3) gets me closer without overextending, keeping distance from the vector at (3,1) to avoid adjacency issues with my precision_shot passive.

No enemies in melee range. I should advance toward the enemy front line to position between allies and enemies. Moving to (3,3) puts me closer to the enemies (Hawk at 4,3, Patch at 3,2) while staying between them and my allies. After moving, I'll use shield_wall facing East toward Hawk to protect adjacent allies from that direction.

Round 1, no enemies in range. I'm at (0,4), enemies are approaching from the south-east area. Move toward center to get better positioning, then place a trap on a likely enemy approach path. Moving to (1,3) gets me closer to allies and into a position to place traps on tiles enemies will traverse. Tile (2,2) or (2,3) would be good trap locations as enemies at (3,1), (3,2), (4,3) will likely advance through that corridor.

Bulwark is at dist=2, within my attack range. Grid is approaching from (1,3). I should place a trap on a likely enemy path — (2,2) or (3,2) would intercept Grid or Bulwark advancing. Then attack Bulwark since it's in range. But trap is blocked if adjacent to an enemy — Bulwark is at dist=2 so I'm not adjacent, trap is available. Place trap at (2,2) to catch Grid advancing, then attack Bulwark at (3,3).

Bulwark sentinel is adjacent at (3,3) — this blocks precision_shot. I need to move away first. Moving to (4,4) puts me 2 tiles from Bulwark (not adjacent), and keeps distance from ally Grid at (3,1). From (4,4), Bulwark at (3,3) is dist~1.4 so still adjacent diagonally — need to check. Better: move to (5,3) puts me 2 tiles from Bulwark. From (5,3), Bulwark is at dist=2, not adjacent, so precision_shot is unblocked. Grid vector is at dist=4 from (5,3), out of range. Bulwark is highest priority target in range. Fire precision_shot at Bulwark for 2dmg (no move penalty since I move first then shoot, but precision_shot deals 1dmg if moved). Still worth it — 1dmg to sentinel.

Patch is at dist=4, exactly in scan range. I already scanned Patch last turn. Hawk and Grid are both out of range at dist=5. I should move closer to bring them into scan range. Moving to (3,4) puts me closer to Hawk at (5,3) — dist would be 2+1=3, in range. But Grid at (3,1) would be dist=3, also in range. From (3,4) I can scan Grid (vector) to learn its prompt — vectors are dangerous and worth knowing. Move to (3,4) then scan Grid at (3,1).

All allies are at full HP, so no healing needed. Bulwark is adjacent at (3,3) — enemy sentinel. I should avoid staying here where I'm exposed. Moving to (4,2) keeps me safe from the enemy Vector's denial range and repositions me. No useful ability targets this turn since allies are full HP and I'm adjacent to an enemy (patch/overclock blocked by Bulwark adjacency). Wait as second action.

Bulwark is at (3,3), dist=2, in range. Orders say trap paths enemies must take. I can trap (2,2) is already trapped. I should place a trap on a key path tile. Moving to (3,2) puts me adjacent to Bulwark which would block my trap ability. Stay at current position (3,1) or move to maintain medium range. Key paths: enemies at (1,3) and (3,4) need to come through middle tiles. Trap (3,2) would be on Bulwark's path toward our backline. But I'm at (3,1) and (3,2) is within range 2 — valid trap target. Place trap at (3,2) to catch Bulwark advancing. Then wait or move to better position. Actually I should move first to avoid being boxed in, then trap. Move to (4,1) to shift east, maintaining range, then trap (3,2) which is a chokepoint between us and Bulwark.

Currently fortified at (3,3) with 50% damage reduction. No enemies in melee range. Hawk and Patch are 2 tiles away to the east. Moving to (4,3) would put me adjacent to Hawk at (5,3) for an attack, and closer to Patch at (4,2). This advances the front line and lets me attack. After moving I lose fortify but can engage Hawk directly.

No enemies in range yet. There's already a trap at (2,2). Enemies are clustered around (4,1)-(5,3). I should advance and place a trap on a likely approach path. Moving to (3,3) gets me closer while staying near Bulwark at (4,3). From there I can place a trap at (3,2) which is between the enemies and our position — likely movement corridor for Grid/Patch approaching from south.

Bulwark is adjacent at (4,3) — this blocks precision_shot. I need to move away first. Moving to (5,4) maintains distance from Bulwark and keeps me away from ally Grid at (4,1). After moving to (5,4), Watcher at (3,4) is dist=2, Grid(vector) at (3,3) is dist=3, Bulwark at (4,3) is dist=2 — all in range and no adjacent enemies to block precision_shot. Watcher(oracle) is high-value per orders. Fire precision_shot on Watcher at (3,4).

Hawk is wounded at 3/4 HP and needs healing, but is 3 tiles away — out of reach this turn. Bulwark (enemy sentinel) is adjacent at (4,3), which is dangerous. I need to move away from Bulwark to safety, ideally toward Hawk to close distance. Moving to (5,3) keeps me away from traps at (2,2)/(3,2), gets me closer to Hawk at (5,4) — adjacent next turn for a heal. From (5,3) Bulwark is no longer adjacent so I'm not in immediate melee threat. No ability this turn since patch requires adjacency to Hawk.

Foresight shows Hawk will move to (5,3) and shoot at (3,3) — targeting our ally Grid. Hawk is already in scan range at dist=2, but I already have Patch and enemy Grid scanned. Hawk is the unknown threat — scan it to reveal its prompt. I'll scan Hawk first (in range at dist=2), then stay put or reposition. Current position (3,4) is safe behind allies at (4,3) and (3,3). No need to move — scan Hawk from here.

Bulwark is at (4,3), distance 2 — within my attack range. Traps already placed at (2,2) and (3,2) covering the left approach. I should trap (4,2) to block the direct path Bulwark would take toward my backline, then attack Bulwark for pressure. I'm not adjacent to enemy Grid so trap is available. Placing trap at (4,2) cuts off Bulwark's advance south toward me.
Patch is adjacent at (5,3) — attack for 1 damage. Stay put to keep Fortify (50% DR) active. No move needed.

Patch is 2 tiles away and in range for attack. Traps at (2,2) and (3,2) already cover southern approach. Enemies may push through (4,2) or (4,3) area. I should place a trap on (4,2) to threaten Grid's path, then attack Patch. Moving to (4,2) would put me adjacent to Bulwark at (4,3) and closer to Grid — risky. Better to stay at (3,3) and use trap on (4,2) since it's within range 2, then attack Patch at (5,3) which is range 2.

Orders say medics first, then damage dealers. Watcher (oracle) is high-value at dist=2, in range. I'm not adjacent to ally Grid (3 tiles away), so precision_shot is not blocked. I haven't moved yet, so no movement penalty. Fire precision_shot on Watcher for 2 dmg. Then move to (5,5) to maintain distance from enemies closing in.

Foresight shows Hawk will move to (5,4) and precision_shot me at (3,4) — I need to move out of that line. I'm at 5/8 HP and Hawk targets high-value units. All three enemies already scanned. Patch is healing the backline. Bulwark is adjacent to Patch at (5,3) range but failed attack. I should recalibrate Bulwark or Grid ally. Grid ally at (3,3) is adjacent to me — I can recalibrate them. Grid enemy has denial active adjacent. My best move: step to (2,4) to dodge Hawk's precision_shot targeting (3,4), then recalibrate ally Grid at (3,3) — wait, after moving to (2,4) they're no longer adjacent. Let me recalibrate first while adjacent, then move. Recalibrate ally Grid at (3,3) with addendum about the trap field and enemy positions, then move to (2,4) to escape Hawk's shot.

firstAction.addendum: Enemy Grid vector at (4,1) has denial blocking adjacent — avoid getting adjacent to it. Trap field at (2-4,2). Enemy Patch medic at (5,3) is priority target behind Hawk striker at (5,5). Push toward (4,2) area carefully to pressure their backline.

actions.thinking: Hawk is wounded at (5,5) dist=2, needs heal. I need to move adjacent to Hawk first, then patch. Moving to (5,4) puts me adjacent to Hawk at (5,5). Bulwark is currently adjacent to me at (4,3) — moving north to (5,4) keeps me away from enemy Vector Grid at (3,3). (5,4) is in my valid moves list. From (5,4), Hawk at (5,5) is adjacent (dist=1), so patch will work.

Trap field at row y=2 is already covered (2,2)(3,2)(4,2). Enemies approaching from south — Patch at (5,4) and Hawk at (5,5) may push toward us. Move to (4,4) first, then trap (5,3) which is within range 2 from (4,4): dist = |5-4|+|3-4|=2, valid.

Traps at (2,2), (3,2), (4,2) already block central approach. Bulwark is at (4,3) dist=2, in range for attack. Grid is at (4,4) dist=3 — must stay away to avoid denial. I can attack Bulwark from current position, then move to (5,2) to maintain range and avoid getting adjacent to Grid. Alternatively, place a trap at (4,2) — but that's already trapped. I should attack Bulwark for 1 dmg, then move to (5,1) to stay at safe distance from Grid while keeping Bulwark in range next turn.

I'm fortified at (4,3) with 50% damage reduction — valuable to maintain if possible. Enemies are at dist 2-3, none adjacent. Trap at (5,3) blocks direct east advance. Patch(medic) at (5,4) and Grid(vector) at (5,2) are both dist 2. I can move to (5,3)... wait, that's a trap. Valid moves include (4,5) and (4,2) but those pull me away from front. I should stay put or move minimally to hold the line. Moving to (3,3) or (3,4) would retreat. Staying at (4,3) keeps fortify and holds position. Ally Grid is at (4,4) to my north. I can shield_wall toward E to protect against Patch at (5,4) — that's the most immediate threat to allies. Shield_wall targets an adjacent ally, so I need Grid(vector) at (4,4) which is adjacent north. Shield_wall direction E would block damage from the east where Patch and enemy Grid are.

I'm at (5,5) with full HP. Enemy Grid(vector) at (4,4) is only 2 tiles away and blocks precision_shot if adjacent. Watcher(oracle) at (2,4) is a high-value target per orders but out of range at dist=4. Bulwark(sentinel) at (4,3) is in range at dist=3. Orders say medics first, then damage dealers — no enemy medic visible, so target damage dealers. Grid(vector) is closest threat at dist=2 and in range. I'm not adjacent to ally Grid, so precision_shot is available. Fire precision_shot on enemy Grid(vector) at (4,4) — dist=2, within range 3, no movement needed so full 2dmg. Then wait to preserve position.

All three enemies already scanned — no scan value remaining. Hawk targeted (3,4) with precision_shot last turn (my current position is 2,4, so I'm safe). Patch is healing the backline. I should recalibrate an ally to help them. Bulwark is at (4,3), Grid ally at (4,4). Recalibrate requires adjacent only — neither is adjacent to me at (2,4). I could move closer to recalibrate Bulwark or Grid ally. Moving to (3,4) puts me adjacent to Bulwark at (4,3) — distance 1 — and Grid ally at (4,4) — diagonal, distance ~1.4 which may count. Moving to (3,3) puts me adjacent to Bulwark at (4,3). Let me move to (3,4) to be adjacent to Bulwark, then recalibrate Bulwark with intel about enemy Grid's denial trap at (5,3) and Patch healing behavior — telling Bulwark to push Patch first.

secondAction.addendum: Enemy Patch at (5,4) heals lowest HP ally each turn — priority target. Enemy Grid has denial trap at (5,3), avoid that tile. Push toward Patch to deny healing; enemy Hawk uses precision_shot on medics and damage dealers from range.

actions.thinking: I'm adjacent to enemy Grid (vector) at (4,4), which means my abilities are blocked by DENIAL. I cannot use patch or overclock. All allies are at full HP anyway, so healing isn't needed. I should move away from the denial zone to safety. Valid moves are (4,5) or (5,3). Moving to (5,3) keeps me away from the enemy cluster. Then I can only attack the adjacent Grid enemy since abilities are blocked — but attack is a basic ability (1dmg melee). Wait, the warning says only basic attack/movement work in denial zone. I'll move first to (5,3) to escape denial, then I'm no longer adjacent to Grid so abilities might be usable — but from (5,3) no allies need healing (all full HP). I'll move to (5,3) and wait since no healing is needed and I'd be out of melee range of enemies.

Patch is wounded at (5,3) just north of me. Bulwark is at (4,3) dist=2, threatening Patch. Grid(enemy) is at (4,4) dist=3 — I must not move adjacent. Traps already cover (2,2),(3,2),(4,2). I should trap (5,4) to protect Patch's flank or pulse Bulwark. Bulwark is in range at dist=2 — pulse hits within 1 tile so that won't reach. I can attack Bulwark at dist=2 since attack is adjacent only — no. My attack range is adjacent only (1 tile). Trap range is ≤2 tiles. I can place a trap at (5,4) to threaten Bulwark if it advances, or move to (5,4) to get closer and use denial to block Bulwark. Wait — if I move to (5,4) I'd be adjacent to Grid(enemy) at (4,4)? dist from (5,4) to (4,4) = 1, yes adjacent — bad, abilities blocked. Move to (4,1) is away from action. Best: place trap at (4,3) — wait, Bulwark is there. Place trap at (5,4) to block path north toward Patch, then wait. Actually trap at (5,4) from current pos (5,2): distance = 2 tiles, valid. This threatens the corridor Bulwark might use.
Patch is adjacent at (5,3) and wounded — priority target per orders. Attack Patch now to deny healing. I'm fortified so staying put preserves 50% damage reduction. No need to move.

Patch is wounded and in range at (5,3) — priority target. I can attack Patch from current position (dist=2, rng=2). Then move to (4,5) to stay away from enemy Grid's denial zone and maintain pressure. Hawk is healthy so Patch is better target to finish off.

I'm adjacent to enemy Grid (vector) at (4,5), which blocks my precision_shot. I need to move away to escape the denial zone first. Valid moves: (3,5), (4,4), (5,4). (5,4) has a trap. (4,4) moves closer to enemies. (3,5) moves me away from Grid and gives distance. After moving to (3,5), Grid is at dist=2, no longer adjacent, so precision_shot unlocks. From (3,5), Watcher at (3,4) is dist=1 (adjacent) — can't use precision_shot on adjacent targets either. Bulwark at (4,3) would be dist=2 from (3,5). Watcher is high value (oracle). From (3,5), I can use precision_shot on Bulwark at (4,3) dist=2 — valid range ≤3, not adjacent, no denial. Orders say medics first then damage dealers — no medic in range. Watcher (oracle) is high value. From (3,5), Watcher at (3,4) is adjacent so precision_shot blocked. Bulwark at dist=2 is valid target for precision_shot. Use precision_shot on Bulwark for 2dmg.
actions.secondResult: Cannot use precision_shot — adjacent to enemy Vector (Denial)

actions.thinking: Hawk is adjacent at (3,5) — dangerous, and already scanned. I'm at 5/8 HP. Grid at (5,4) is placing a trap there (from Foresight), so I should avoid (5,4). Patch is wounded at (5,3) — priority target for recalibrate isn't useful here. Best move: step back to (2,4) to escape Hawk's adjacency and stay safe. Then recalibrate Bulwark at (4,3) — Bulwark is adjacent to Patch (wounded medic) and could be told to prioritize attacking Patch to finish them off.

secondAction.addendum: Enemy medic Patch is wounded at (5,3) — prioritize attacking Patch to eliminate them before they heal. Hawk at (3,5) is also a threat.

actions.thinking: I'm at 2/6 HP with Bulwark adjacent — dangerous. Both allies are at full HP so I cannot heal. I need to escape. Move to (5,5) to get away from Bulwark and avoid the trap at (5,4). Then wait — no wounded allies to heal, overclock would require adjacency and I'd take damage I can't afford.

Bulwark is at (4,3), dist=2 and in range. I'm at (5,2). I can't trap adjacent to an enemy if they're adjacent to me — but Bulwark is at dist=2, not adjacent. However, trap is blocked when adjacent to enemy Vector; the enemy Vector is at (4,5), dist=4, not adjacent. So trap is available. Valid trap tiles are ≤2 tiles away on empty tiles. (5,3) is not listed as a valid move but I need to check trap target — (5,4) already has a trap. (4,2) is a valid move tile and likely empty. I want to trap the path toward my backline. Patch is at (5,5), Hawk at (3,5). Enemy Grid is coming from (4,5). Trapping (5,3) would block the path between Bulwark and Patch. Let me check: current traps at (2,2),(3,2),(4,2),(5,4). So (4,2) already has a trap. I could trap (5,3) — it's within 2 tiles of my position at (5,2). Distance from (5,2) to (5,3) = 1, within range. That tile appears empty (no trap listed there). This would block the corridor to Patch. I'll trap (5,3) then pulse Bulwark if possible — actually pulse is 1dmg to ALL within 1 tile (adjacent), but Bulwark is at dist=2 so pulse won't reach. I'll trap (5,3) first, then move to (5,3) — wait, if I move onto (5,3) after trapping it I'd trigger my own trap. Better: trap (5,3), stay put or move elsewhere. Or: move first then trap. Move to (5,1) to maintain medium range from Bulwark, then trap a path tile. From (5,1), I can trap within 2 tiles — could trap (4,2) but it's already trapped, or (5,2),(5,3),(4,1),(3,1). Let me trap (5,3) from current position (no move needed), blocking Bulwark's approach corridor to Patch. Then wait or move away.

Patch is wounded at (5,5) and is a priority target. I can move to (5,4) to get adjacent to Patch and attack. Moving loses Fortify but getting an attack on wounded Patch is worth it. (5,3) has a denial trap so avoid it. Moving to (5,4) puts me adjacent to Patch at (5,5).

Patch is critical and adjacent at (5,5) — killing it is top priority. Attack Patch first to finish it off. Then attack Hawk at (3,5) which is also adjacent. Two attacks on adjacent enemies is optimal use of my turn.

I'm adjacent to enemy Grid (vector) at (4,5) which has DENIAL ACTIVE — precision_shot is blocked. I need to move away first to escape the denial zone, then use precision_shot. Priority targets: Watcher (oracle/support class) at (2,4) is high value. Moving to (2,5) gets me away from Grid's denial zone and keeps Watcher at dist=1 in range. From (2,5) I can use precision_shot on Watcher. Let me check valid moves: [1,5],[2,5],[3,3],[3,4],[4,4],[5,5]. Moving to (2,5) puts me dist=1 from Watcher and escapes denial.

I'm at (2,4) with 4/8 HP, adjacent to Hawk at (2,5). Hawk is a threat but tried precision_shot last turn and failed. I need to stay safe while being useful. I already have scans on both enemies. I should recalibrate an ally — Bulwark at (5,4) is too far (adjacent only). Grid ally at (4,5) is also too far. My best move is to reposition away from Hawk to stay alive, then recalibrate if possible. Moving to (3,4) keeps me at range 2 from Hawk. From (3,4), I can check if any ally is adjacent — Grid ally is at (4,5), which would be adjacent diagonally but recalibrate requires adjacent. Let me move to (4,4) — Grid ally at (4,5) would be adjacent. From (4,4), I can recalibrate Grid ally at (4,5) to warn about the trap field and coordinate. This gets me away from Hawk and lets me support Grid.

secondAction.addendum: Enemy Grid vector at (5,1) uses denial on adjacent tiles and has traps at (2,2),(3,2),(4,2). Avoid those rows. Enemy Hawk uses precision_shot on high-value targets and suppressing_fire when enemies close. Keep distance from Hawk. You are healthy — push toward enemy Grid but watch for denial zone.

actions.thinking: I'm at (5,1) facing S with full HP. Enemies are Bulwark at (5,4), Watcher at (4,4), Grid enemy at (4,5). I have traps at (2,2),(3,2),(4,2),(5,3). The trap at (5,3) is already blocking the path south toward me. I should move to (4,1) to get better positioning, then place a trap at (4,2) — wait, (4,2) already has a trap. Valid moves include (4,2) but that has a trap. Let me think: valid tiles are [3,1],[4,0],[4,1],[4,2],[5,0],[5,2],[5,3]. Trap is already at (5,3) and (4,2). I should place a new trap to channel enemies. Moving to (5,2) keeps pressure on the south corridor. From (5,2) I can place a trap at (4,2) — already trapped. I could trap (3,1) or another approach tile. Let me move to (4,1) to reposition centrally, then trap (3,1) to cover the western approach path toward our backline. That places mines along likely enemy routes.

Hawk is at (2,5), distance 2 — in range for attack (adjacent only, dist=2 is not adjacent). I can't attack Hawk from here. Valid moves: (3,4),(3,5),(4,3),(5,5). Moving to (3,5) puts me adjacent to Hawk at (2,5) for a melee attack. But Hawk is healthy and I'm wounded at 4HP — risky. Orders say push toward (4,2) area carefully. Or place trap now from (4,5) targeting a tile within 2 range that enemies might traverse. (4,4) is occupied by Watcher ally. (3,4) or (3,5) could be trap targets. I'm fortified at (5,4) with 7HP. Watcher is wounded at (4,4) adjacent to me. No enemies in attack range. Orders say to push toward enemy Patch at (5,3) to deny healing, but (5,3) has a denial trap — avoid it. Valid moves include (5,5) or (4,5). I should position to protect Watcher with shield_wall. Watcher is to my west at (4,4), threat comes from west (Hawk at (2,5)). I'll use shield_wall facing W to protect Watcher. I'll stay in place to maintain fortify and cast shield_wall west to cover Watcher.

Both enemies already scanned — no scan value left. I'm at 4HP, Hawk is targeting high-value units with precision_shot and already moved to (2,5). Foresight shows Hawk shot at (2,4) last turn. Grid enemy is placing traps at (3,1) and already trapped (3,4). Bulwark did shield_wall facing W at (4,4) — that's my current position, giving me cover. I should recalibrate Bulwark at (5,4) — adjacent — to help them counter Hawk's precision_shot strategy. Then stay safe. Bulwark is adjacent at (5,4).

firstAction.addendum: Hawk uses precision_shot targeting high-value units. Prioritize blocking Hawk's line of fire and intercepting at (2,5). Enemy Grid at (4,1) lays traps — avoid moving through (3,1),(3,2),(4,2),(2,2).

actions.thinking: Watcher (oracle) is wounded at dist=2, highest priority target. I'm at (2,5), Watcher at (4,5). No adjacent enemies so precision_shot is not blocked. Fire precision_shot on Watcher first (2dmg to wounded oracle = likely kill). Then maintain distance by holding position or repositioning away from the vector at (4,3) which could close in. Since orders say maintain distance, after shooting I'll move west to (1,5) to increase separation from enemies.

Enemy Grid(vector) is at (4,3), dist=2, directly north. I'm at (4,1). I cannot use trap while adjacent to enemy Vector, but dist=2 means I'm not adjacent yet. However, (4,2) is already trapped. Pulse hits all within 1 tile — Grid is at dist=2 so pulse won't reach. I can place a trap to block paths. (5,2) is a valid move tile and would let me stay at range. (5,2) is empty and valid move tile — I can trap it to block flanking routes. Or I can move to (3,1)... wait, (3,1) is already a trap. Let me trap (5,2) from current position — it's within 2 tiles and empty, blocking eastern flank. Then move west to (3,1)... that's a trap. Move to (2,1) to stay safe and maintain denial pressure indirectly.

Watcher is critical at (4,5) and needs protection. Hawk at (1,5) uses precision_shot targeting high-value units — Watcher is prime target. I should move to (5,5) to stay adjacent to Watcher and use shield_wall West to block Hawk's line of fire. Currently fortified but moving will break that — worth it to protect critical ally. I'm at (4,3) with 4/6 HP. Enemy Grid is at (3,1), 3 tiles away — must not get adjacent. Traps already at (2,2),(3,2),(4,2),(3,4). Row 2 is well covered. I should place a trap somewhere enemies might path through. Moving to (5,3) keeps me away from enemy Grid's denial zone and away from existing traps. Let me move to (5,2) and place a trap at (4,1) to cut off Grid's eastward movement. Wait — (4,1) is reachable from (5,2)? From (5,2), trap range is ≤2 tiles, so (4,1) would be within range. But I need to not be adjacent to enemy Grid at (3,1) — (4,1) would be 1 tile from Grid, so I can't be AT (4,1). But placing a trap there from (5,2) at distance 2 is fine as long as I'm not adjacent to enemy Grid. From (5,2), dist to Grid(3,1) = 3 tiles, safe. Place trap at (4,1) to block Grid's eastern escape.

I'm at 2HP — critical condition. Foresight shows Hawk used precision_shot on my position last turn and is at (1,5). I need to survive. Bulwark used shield_wall facing W toward (4,5) which gives me cover. I should move to (5,4) to get behind Bulwark and away from Hawk's line of fire. Both enemies already scanned so no scan value. I can recalibrate Bulwark at (5,5) from (5,4) — adjacent — to reinforce their defensive posture against Hawk.

secondAction.addendum: Priority: shield Watcher from Hawk at (1,5). Hawk uses precision_shot on high-value targets. Keep shield_wall facing W to block line of sight to our backline.

actions.thinking: Watcher (oracle) is critical priority per orders — medics/oracles first. Currently at dist=5, out of my range-3. Need to close to range 3. I'm at (1,5). Watcher is at (5,4). Moving to (3,5) gets me to dist=2 horizontally+1 vertically = still 3 tiles from (5,4)? Dist from (3,5) to (5,4) = |5-3|+|4-5| = 2+1 = 3. That's within range 3. No adjacent enemies so High Ground passive gives +1 range (range 4), but precision_shot is range ≤3 base. Move to (3,5), then precision_shot Watcher at (5,4) for 2dmg — would finish off critical target.

I'm at (3,1) with a trap already on my current tile. Enemy Grid(vector) is at (5,2) wounded and 3 tiles away — I need to stay out of adjacent range (≤1 tile) to keep my abilities. There are traps at (2,2),(3,2),(4,2),(5,3),(3,1). The enemy Grid is moving south toward our backline. I should move to (4,1) to get closer to Grid without going adjacent, then trap a tile in their path. (4,2) already has a trap. I can trap (5,1) or another tile to cover their approach. Moving to (4,1) keeps me 2 tiles from Grid at (5,2) — safe from Denial. Then I can trap (5,1) to cut off their southern movement path.

Watcher is critical at (5,4) and needs protection. Hawk at (3,5) is 2 tiles away and will target Watcher with precision_shot. I'm at (5,5) and fortified. I should shield_wall facing W to block Hawk's line of fire toward Watcher. Stay in place to keep fortify bonus and protect Watcher.

I'm at (5,2) with 2HP - critically low. Grid enemy is at (4,1) distance 2, so I can target it with trap at range ≤2. Moving adjacent to Grid would trigger denial blocking trap, so I need to stay at distance. Valid moves include (5,3) which keeps distance from Grid at (4,1). I should place a trap to pressure Grid's movement, then move to safety. Trap at (4,2) is already placed. I can place trap on (5,1) or (4,3) to extend coverage. Grid is at (4,1) moving East - placing trap at (5,1) or (4,3) could catch it. Let me move to (5,3) first to stay away from Grid, then place trap at (4,3) which Grid might walk through. Wait - trap requires being ≤2 tiles from target. From (5,2), (4,3) is dist ~1.4, valid. But I should move first. If I move to (5,3), then (4,3) is still within range 2 for trap. Actually, place trap first from current position (5,2) targeting (4,3) since Grid at (4,1) might move north/east, then move to (5,3) for safety away from Grid.

Watcher is at critical HP — priority target. I'm at (3,5), Watcher at (5,4), distance 3, in range for precision_shot. I haven't moved yet so no penalty. After shooting Watcher, move to (4,4) to maintain distance from Bulwark at (5,5) while keeping pressure. Avoid moving first since precision_shot gets -1dmg if moved.

Bulwark is far at dist=5, no enemies in range. I have traps at (2,2),(3,2),(4,2),(3,1),(5,1) already covering good paths. I should move to a better position and place another trap. Moving to (4,3) puts me at medium range and I can trap (5,2) to cover the eastern approach route Bulwark might use coming from (5,5) southward.

I'm at (5,5) fortified with 7HP. No enemies in attack range. Hawk is at (4,4) dist=2, Grid at (4,3) dist=3. Orders say to hold front line and shield allies. I should maintain fortify bonus by not moving, and use shield_wall facing W or S to block Hawk's precision_shot on our backline. Staying put keeps 50% damage reduction active. Shield wall facing W protects allies from Hawk at (4,4).

Bulwark is at (5,5), dist=2, healthy. I'm at (4,4) with no adjacent enemies, so precision_shot is available and High Ground passive may apply. Orders say maintain distance and use precision_shot on high-value targets. Bulwark is the only enemy in range. I can shoot first then move to maintain distance, or move then shoot. Since precision_shot does 1dmg if moved, I should shoot first then reposition. Shooting Bulwark at (5,5) from (4,4) for 2dmg. Then move to (3,4) to increase distance from Bulwark.

Currently fortified at (5,5) with 50% damage reduction. Both enemies are 3 tiles away, out of attack range. Orders say to hold front line and shield allies. I should maintain fortify bonus by not moving, and use shield_wall facing W to block Hawk's line of fire toward our backline. Staying put preserves fortify and lets me shield wall.

I'm at (4,3) with 2HP, critical condition. Bulwark is at (5,5) dist=3, wounded. Hawk is critical ally at (3,4). I have traps covering rows 1-2 extensively. Bulwark must come through (5,4) or (4,4) to reach us. I should move to (4,4) to intercept and use Denial to block Bulwark's abilities, or trap (5,4) to cut off their approach route. Since trap is blocked when adjacent to enemy and Bulwark is dist=3, I can still trap. Trap (5,4) to catch Bulwark's likely approach path, then move to (4,4) to apply Denial pressure.

I'm at 1HP — critical priority is survival. Bulwark is at dist=3, wounded. I can fire precision_shot from current position (in range, no adjacent enemies blocking). I'm not adjacent to any enemy, so precision_shot is available. Fire first, then move away to maintain distance. Moving to (2,5) puts me further from Bulwark and avoids the trap cluster.

I'm at 2HP - critical condition. Bulwark is wounded at (5,5), distance 2. I'm in range to attack. Hawk is also critical at (2,5). I should attack Bulwark since it's wounded and in range - a kill would help secure the area. After attacking, I should move to a safer position. (5,4) has a trap already placed there which is good for area denial. I'll attack Bulwark first, then move to maintain pressure while staying cautious given my low HP.

I'm at (5,5) with 5HP, fortified (50% DR). Hawk is at (2,5) critical, Grid at (3,4) wounded, both 3 tiles away — out of attack range. Moving to (4,5) gets me closer to Hawk along row 5, still avoiding Grid's denial at (5,3). From (4,5) I can't reach Hawk yet but I'm positioned to intercept. Better to move to (4,5) and use shield_wall facing W to protect allies from Hawk's precision_shot along row 5. I lose fortify by moving but gain position. Actually, staying fortified with 50% DR at 5HP is valuable. I'll hold position and use shield_wall facing W to block Hawk's line of fire toward our backline.

I'm at (2,5) with 1HP — critical condition. Bulwark is at (5,5), dist=3, wounded. I have a clear shot with precision_shot (range ≤3, no adjacent enemies blocking). I haven't moved yet so precision_shot fires at full 2dmg. Bulwark is wounded — finishing it could be decisive. I should stay at current position to avoid moving penalty on precision_shot, then wait or reposition after firing. No adjacent enemies so High Ground passive may apply (+1 rng). Priority: shoot first, then hold position.

I'm at (5,5) with 4HP, fortified. No enemies in range. Orders say push toward Patch at (5,4) to deny healing and shield_wall W to block Hawk. I can move to (5,4) to pressure Patch — but Grid has denial trap at (5,3) so I must avoid that tile. Moving to (5,4) is valid and puts me on Patch's position. Then shield_wall W to block Hawk's line of fire toward our backline.

I'm at 2HP, critical. Bulwark is adjacent (dist=2) to my east, also critical. I can attack Bulwark from range 2 to potentially finish it. But I'm also at risk. Hawk is at (2,5) critical too. I should attack Bulwark since it's in range and critical - one more hit could finish it. Attack costs no movement so I can also move to safer position. Let me attack first, then move west/away to create distance.

I'm at 1HP — critical priority to survive. Bulwark is critical and in range at dist=4. I can precision_shot from current position (no adjacent enemies, so not blocked). Move to 4,5 to close slightly but maintain distance, then precision_shot Bulwark to finish them off. Actually, Bulwark is already in range from current position, so I should shoot first then reposition if needed. But I'm first in order so shoot now. Stay put and precision_shot Bulwark — they're critical so 2dmg should eliminate them. Moving first could trigger the 1dmg penalty on precision_shot. Best: precision_shot first from (2,5), then move to safety if needed.

I'm at (2,4) with 2HP, critical condition. Bulwark is at (5,4) dist=3, critical too. Ally Hawk is at (3,5) critical. I need to trap paths to protect our backline. Bulwark is likely moving west toward us. I should place a trap along their approach path. (4,4) is a valid move tile and puts me closer to deny Bulwark while also letting me trap. Actually, I should trap (4,4) or (4,3) to block Bulwark's westward approach. I can move to (3,4) then trap (4,4) — that blocks the direct path. Or trap from current position: (2,2),(2,3) are valid but those are behind. Let me trap (3,3) from current pos — wait, trap range is ≤2 tiles. From (2,4), (3,3) is sqrt(2)≤2, valid. But better to trap (4,4) which is Bulwark's likely approach. From (2,4), (4,4) is dist=2, valid range. I'll trap (4,4) to block Bulwark's advance, then move west to (1,4) to stay safe at 2HP.

I'm at critical 1HP with fortify active (50% dmg reduction). No enemies in range. Hawk is at (3,5) dist=3 threatening from the east side. I should move toward (4,5) to close distance and position between allies and Hawk, then use shield_wall facing W to block Hawk's line of fire to our backline. Moving to (4,5) keeps me in a blocking position.
